Calculate Triage Effectiveness

Source: R/calc_wte.R
calc_wte.Rd

Calculates triage effectiveness metrics including Observed Triage Effectiveness (OTE), Theoretical Triage Effectiveness (TTE), and their bootstrap confidence intervals if requested. Note the separate help section on convergence documentation.

Usage

calc_wte(
  df,
  subgroup = NULL,
  var1 = NULL,
  var2 = NULL,
  bootstrap = FALSE,
  bootstrap_params = list(sample_percentage = 1, n_iterations = 2000, distribution_span =
    0.95),
  n_workers = parallel::detectCores() - 1,
  overall_only = FALSE,
  check_convergence = TRUE,
  min_loset_warning = 5,
  seed = NULL
)

Arguments

df

Data frame containing patient data (must be initialized through init())

subgroup

Optional list for subgroup analysis - an alternative to var1/2

var1

Optional string for first comparison variable

var2

Optional string for second comparison variable

bootstrap

Logical or character. Whether to perform bootstrap calculations and what method to use:

  • FALSE: No bootstrapping (default)

  • TRUE or "standard": Standard patient-level bootstrapping

  • "segment": A custom type of Block bootstrapping using queue segments

bootstrap_params

List of bootstrap parameters:

  • sample_percentage (default: 1) How large of the sample is used? 1 = full sample. In segment bootstrapping this reffers to the percentage of samples that are used

  • n_iterations (default: 2000) How many bootstrap iterations to use

  • distribution_span (default: 0.95) What is the confidence interval used?

n_workers

Number of workers for parallel processing (default: detectCores() - 1)

overall_only

Logical. If TRUE, only overall metrics are returned (default: FALSE)

check_convergence

Logical. If true will return a list with convergence plots, if bootstrap is done (default: TRUE)

min_loset_warning

Numerical, when should the function warn for low loset prevalence? (default: 5)

seed

Seed for reproducible bootstrapping (default: NULL - no seed)

Value

A list containing:

  • results: Tibble with TE metrics:

    • unit: Medical specialty unit or "overall" for combined results

    • n_patients: Total number of patients in the group

    • n_patients_loset: Number of LOSET-positive (time-critical) patients

    • loset_prevalence: Proportion of LOSET-positive patients

    • mean_all: Mean waiting time for all patients

    • ote_mean_loset: Mean observed waiting time for LOSET patients

    • ote_te: Observed Triage Effectiveness

    • tte_mean_loset: Mean theoretical waiting time for LOSET patients

    • tte_te: Theoretical Triage Effectiveness

    • btte_mean_loset: Mean binary theoretical waiting time for LOSET patients

    • btte_te: Binary Theoretical Triage Effectiveness

    • otg_te: Observed-Theoretical Gap (ote_te - tte_te)

    • sensitivity: True positive rate for identifying time-critical patients

    • specificity: True negative rate for identifying non-time-critical patients

    • boot_ote_mean: Bootstrap mean for OTE (if bootstrap=TRUE)

    • boot_ote_sd: Bootstrap standard deviation for OTE

    • boot_ote_sd_q: Robust standard deviation for OTE based on IQR, Calculated as IQR/1.349

    • boot_ote_var_lower: Lower bound of OTE confidence interval

    • boot_ote_var_upper: Upper bound of OTE confidence interval

    • boot_tte_mean: Bootstrap mean for TTE

    • boot_tte_sd: Bootstrap standard deviation for TTE

    • boot_tte_sd_q: Robust standard deviation for TTE based on IQR, Calculated as IQR/1.349

    • boot_tte_var_lower: Lower bound of TTE confidence interval

    • boot_tte_var_upper: Upper bound of TTE confidence interval

    • boot_btte_mean: Bootstrap mean for BTTE

    • boot_btte_sd: Bootstrap standard deviation for BTTE

    • boot_btte_sd_q: Robust standard deviation for BTTE based on IQR, Calculated as IQR/1.349

    • boot_btte_var_lower: Lower bound of BTTE confidence interval

    • boot_btte_var_upper: Upper bound of BTTE confidence interval

    • boot_mean_n_patients: Mean number of patients across bootstrap samples

    • boot_mean_n_loset: Mean number of LOSET patients across bootstrap samples

  • metadata: List containing calculation parameters:

    • calculation_time: Timestamp of when calculation was performed

    • bootstrap_params: List of parameters used for bootstrap (if applicable):

      • sample_percentage: Fraction of data used in each bootstrap iteration

      • n_iterations: Number of bootstrap iterations performed

      • distribution_span: Width of confidence intervals (e.g., 0.95 for 95% CI)

    • bootstrap_method: Type of bootstrap method use - standard or segment (if applicable)

    • group_var1: First grouping variable used (if any)

    • group_var2: Second grouping variable used (if any)

    • subgr: Subgroup criteria used (if any)

  • bootstrap_distributions: Full bootstrap iteration data (if bootstrap=TRUE)

  • convergence: Convergence analysis results (if check_convergence=TRUE)

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic calculation
te_results <- calc_te(patient_data)

# With bootstrap
te_results <- calc_te(patient_data,
                     bootstrap = TRUE)

# With subgroup analysis
te_results <- calc_te(patient_data,
                     subgroup = list(age_group = "elderly"))
} # }
